definitions: member of a Protestant Christian denomination that originated in the Anglican tradition
Protestant denomination emphasizing evangelical faith and social justice
examples: The Methodist church organized a community outreach program
My grandmother has been a devout Methodist for sixty years
Methodist teachings emphasize personal faith and social responsibility
The United Methodist Church is the largest Methodist denomination worldwide

definitions: biblical figure who lived 969 years according to the Book of Genesis
person of exceptionally great age or something very old and outdated
wine bottle holding six liters, equivalent to eight standard bottles
examples: Methuselah was the oldest person mentioned in the Bible
According to Genesis, Methuselah lived before the Great Flood
That computer is a real Methuselah, probably twenty years old
The professor was a Methuselah who remembered the university's founding
The collector proudly displayed a Methuselah of vintage champagne
A Methuselah bottle makes an impressive centerpiece at celebrations

definitions: person who is a citizen or native of Mexico
characteristic of or relating to Mexico, its people, or culture
examples: The Mexican artist displayed her paintings at the gallery
Many Mexicans celebrate Day of the Dead in November
Mexican cuisine features tortillas, beans, and spicy peppers
The Mexican peso is the official currency of Mexico

definitions: Spanish term for a Mexican person or someone of Mexican descent
person who speaks Mexican Spanish as their native language
examples: The Mexicano community celebrates their heritage with traditional festivals
He identified himself as Mexicano rather than Hispanic
The Mexicano dialect has unique vocabulary not found in other Spanish varieties
Many Mexicanos in California maintain their linguistic traditions

definitions: mebibyte, a unit of computer data equal to 1,048,576 bytes
management information base in network management systems
small glass ball used in the children's game of marbles
examples: The file size is 50 MiB, which will take a minute to download
Modern operating systems display storage in MiB rather than MB
The network administrator configured the MIB for SNMP monitoring
Each device has its own MIB containing management information
The child's favorite mib was a blue and white swirled marble
He won three mibs in the schoolyard marble game

definitions: region comprising Southwest Asia and parts of North Africa, also known as the Middle East
examples: Political tensions in the Mideast affect global oil prices
The Mideast encompasses diverse cultures and religions
Many archaeological discoveries have been made in the Mideast region
The Mideast peace process has been ongoing for decades

definitions: Musical Instrument Digital Interface, a technical standard for electronic musical instruments
skirt or dress hemline that falls between the knee and ankle
southern region of France, particularly the area around the Mediterranean
examples: The keyboard connects to the computer through a MIDI cable
Musicians use MIDI files to compose and edit digital music
She wore a floral midi dress to the garden party
Midi skirts became fashionable again in recent years
They vacationed in the Midi, enjoying the Mediterranean climate
The Midi region produces excellent wines and olive oil

definitions: central part of a country, especially the middle counties of England
area of land that is distant from the coast or borders
examples: Birmingham is the largest city in the English Midlands
The Midlands experienced rapid industrialization in the 19th century
The midland regions often have different weather patterns than coastal areas
Farmers in the midland counties grow different crops than those near the sea

definitions: ancient Jewish commentary on Hebrew scriptures, especially rabbinical interpretations
Jewish method of interpreting biblical stories to derive moral teachings
examples: The rabbi studied various midrash texts to understand the Torah passage
This midrash explains the deeper meaning behind the biblical story
The midrash method reveals hidden meanings in scripture
Students learned how midrash connects ancient texts to modern life

definitions: point or position that is halfway between two places or extremes
area at a fair or carnival where games and amusements are located

examples: We stopped for lunch midway through our journey to Boston

Children enjoyed the rides and games along the carnival midway
The midway featured cotton candy stands and ring toss games

definitions: middle part of the week, typically Tuesday through Thursday
examples: Hotel rates are usually lower for midweek stays
The meeting was scheduled for midweek to maximize attendance
Midweek services at the church are held on Wednesday evenings
Traffic is generally lighter during midweek mornings

definitions: north-central region of the United States including states like Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, and Ohio
examples: The Midwest is known for its agricultural production and farming communities
Chicago is the largest city in the American Midwest
Midwest winters can be harsh with heavy snow and cold temperatures
Many Midwest states are part of the corn belt

definitions: person who is from or lives in Milan, Italy
characteristic style or method originating from Milan, especially in cooking
examples: The Milanese designer showcased her collection at fashion week
Many Milanese commute by tram through the city center
The restaurant serves authentic risotto alla milanese with saffron
Milanese fashion is known for sophisticated elegance

definitions: white liquid produced by female mammals to feed their young
white liquid extracted from plants like coconuts, almonds, or soybeans
examples: The baby drinks her mother's milk for essential nutrients
Fresh milk from the dairy arrives every morning
She prefers almond milk in her coffee instead of dairy
Coconut milk adds richness to Thai curry dishes

definitions: building with machinery for grinding grain into flour
factory or plant for manufacturing or processing materials
device or machine for grinding, crushing, or pulverizing substances
examples: The old water mill has been restored as a tourist attraction
Farmers brought their wheat to the mill for grinding
The steel mill employs thousands of workers in the region
The paper mill processes recycled materials into new products
She uses a pepper mill to grind fresh black pepper
The coffee mill produces perfectly ground beans for espresso

definitions: person who owns or operates a mill for grinding grain
common family name of English occupational origin
type of moth with powdery wings that appears dusty like flour
examples: The miller ground wheat into flour for the entire village

Arthur Miller wrote Death of a Salesman and other famous plays
The Millers moved into the house next door last month
A miller moth flew around the porch light last night
Miller moths migrate through the region every spring

definitions: small-seeded cereal grain grown as food crop in Africa and Asia
grass plant that produces millet grain, drought-resistant and nutritious
examples: Millet porridge is a staple breakfast in many African countries
The bakery uses millet flour for gluten-free bread
Farmers plant millet because it grows well in dry conditions
Pearl millet is the most widely grown type of millet

definitions: abbreviation for minute, a unit of time equal to sixty seconds
abbreviation for minimum, the smallest or lowest amount
examples: The recipe requires baking for 30 min at 350 degrees
The meeting will start in 5 min, please take your seats

Set the min value to zero in the spreadsheet formula

definitions: Roman goddess of wisdom, warfare, and crafts, equivalent to Greek Athena
symbol or representation of wisdom and strategic warfare in art and literature
examples: The temple of Minerva stood in the Roman Forum for centuries
Minerva was often depicted with an owl and a spear
The university's seal features Minerva as a symbol of learning
In the painting, Minerva represents the triumph of wisdom over ignorance

definitions: member of the Bronze Age civilization that flourished on Crete from 3000-1100 BCE

examples: The Minoans developed one of Europe's earliest advanced civilizations

Minoan pottery features distinctive marine motifs and vibrant colors

definitions: mythological creature with the head of a bull and the body of a man from Greek mythology
examples: The Minotaur was imprisoned in the labyrinth beneath the palace of Knossos

definitions: American colonial militia member ready to fight at a minute's notice during the Revolutionary War
intercontinental ballistic missile system used by the United States Air Force
examples: The minutemen fought British troops at Lexington and Concord
Minuteman statues commemorate these colonial militia fighters
The Minuteman III missile system remains part of America's nuclear deterrent
Minuteman missile silos are located in several midwestern states

definitions: geological epoch from about 23 to 5 million years ago, marked by the evolution of many modern mammals
examples: Many modern mammal families first appeared during the Miocene epoch

definitions: first major written collection of Jewish oral traditions and laws, compiled around 200 CE
examples: Rabbinical students spend years studying the Mishnah and its commentaries

Each section of the Mishnah addresses different aspects of Jewish law
The Mishnah preserves teachings passed down through generations

definitions: geological period from about 359 to 323 million years ago, part of the Carboniferous

person who lives in or is from the state of Mississippi
examples: Mississippian limestone formations contain many marine fossils

definitions: title of respect for a man, usually abbreviated as Mr.
device that sprays a fine mist of water or other liquid
examples: Mister Johnson will see you in his office now

The mister attachment turns the hose into a cooling spray

definitions: capable of moving or being moved readily from place to place
decorative hanging structure with balanced parts that move
portable cellular telephone device
port city in Alabama on the Gulf Coast
examples: The mobile home can be transported to a new location

definitions: wealthy and powerful person, especially in business or entertainment industry
mound of hard snow on a ski slope formed by skier traffic

definitions: member of an Iroquois people originally from the Mohawk River valley
hairstyle with shaved sides and a strip of hair down the center
river in New York state that flows into the Hudson River
examples: The Mohawk nation was part of the powerful Iroquois Confederacy

definitions: second day of the week in many countries, first day of the work week
examples: The meeting is scheduled for Monday morning at nine o'clock

The restaurant is closed on Mondays for maintenance

definitions: member of a Central Asian people who created a vast empire under Genghis Khan

examples: The Mongol warrior rode across the steppes on horseback

definitions: person who is a citizen or native of Mongolia

definitions: electronic display screen for computers or television systems
person who observes, checks, or supervises something

definitions: man who is a member of a religious order living in a monastery under vows

definitions: exclusive control of a commodity, service, or market by a single entity

examples: The company held a monopoly on telephone service for decades

definitions: French title of respect for a man, equivalent to Mister in English
examples: Monsieur Dupont owns the bakery on the corner

definitions: honorary title given to certain Roman Catholic priests by the Pope

definitions: Earth's natural satellite that orbits the planet and reflects sunlight

The teenager got in trouble for mooning the school bus

definitions: area of open uncultivated upland, typically covered with heather

of or relating to the Moors or their culture

definitions: religious tradition and theology of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

definitions: informal offensive term for a person considered extremely foolish or stupid

definitions: telegraph code using dots and dashes to represent letters and numbers

examples: Ships transmitted SOS signals using Morse code

definitions: artwork made by arranging small pieces of colored glass, stone, or tile

definitions: alternate spelling of Muslim, a follower of Islam, now considered outdated

definitions: record company founded in Detroit that created a distinctive soul music sound
style of soul music with pop influences developed by Motown Records

definitions: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, influential Austrian composer of the Classical period 1756-1791
reference to exceptional musical talent or genius, derived from the composer
examples: Mozart composed over 600 works during his short life
